etymologies: 1940s. From scientific Latin patulum, specific epithet of Penicillium patulum + -in (compare quot. 1943

definitions: A heterocyclic antibiotic compound, C₇ H₆ O₄, which has carcinogenic properties and is obtained from any of several moulds (originally from Penicillium patulum).

notes.text: It was later found to be identical with clavacin (also called clavatin, claviformin).
